articles.title: About this blog
articles.contents:
Overview
Worked in the IT industry for 24 years with experience in a multi-vendor environment in physical and global virtual teams.
Using MS Office products, most recently the Power Query and Power Pivot tools in MS Excel, to produce high quality views and analysis of large data sets.
Recently learning the R programming language to analyse large data sets and to produce data visualisations
Mentoring and coaching colleagues, allowing them to move onto new career paths and positions
Achievements
Using the R programming language to analysis over 4.5 million rows of data to identify blockages in processes
Providing senior management with both an overview and detailed view of outstanding debt
Reducing a daily six hour task to less than 15 minutes per day by automating email creation for new work requests
Reducing turn around times for client non-standard service requests from over 80 days to less than 10 working days
Self service tool for users to extract data and present in a variety of charting formats
A tool to collate estimated prices for work in a consistent format and to supply summarised reports to clients; identifying stale sales opportunities worth over $12m
Management of a global Change Request process to monitor and implement changes from project teams and clients
Testimonials

 Adept at taking user requirements (usually vague verbal/email requests) and responding with astutely accurate deliverables.
And he delivers quickly to boot  - Former Project Manager


 You leave behind a legacy you can be proud of and that will have a lasting impact on the careers of all who learned from you. - Former Team Leader


 LinkedIn
  |  
 GitHub

articles.title: Projects
articles.contents:
Data Visualisations of Covid-19 Data
Experimenting various methods of visualising Covid-19 data using ggplot2 in R
Part 1 - Downloading Covid-19 Data
Part 2 - Visualing the Top Ten Areas with the UK
Part 3 - Visualing Covid-19 Data on a map of the UK
Part 4 - Visualising Covid-19 Numbers
Non-Pivot Table Summaries
Using the new spilled array dynamic functions in MS Excel 365 to present summaries in data using just one formula
Part 1 - Build a basic one cell summary
Part 2 - Using the LET function to build a one cell summary
Part 3 - Using the HSTACK and VSTACK functions to build a one cell summary
